name: databricks_list_apps
description: List all Databricks Apps in the workspace.

name: databricks_get_app
description: Get detailed information about a specific Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app. Must be a lowercase alphanumeric string

name: databricks_create_app
description: Create a new Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app. Must contain only lowercase alphanumeric

arguments.name: description
arguments.desc: Optional human-readable description of the app's purpose.

name: databricks_deploy_app
description: Deploy source code to a Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app to deploy to.

arguments.name: source_code_path
arguments.desc: The workspace filesystem path of the source code

arguments.name: mode
arguments.desc: Deployment mode. "SNAPSHOT" (default) creates an immutable copy

name: databricks_delete_app
description: Delete a Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app to delete.

name: databricks_start_app
description: Start a Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app to start.

name: databricks_stop_app
description: Stop a running Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app to stop.

name: databricks_list_app_deployments
description: List all deployments for a Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app whose deployments to list.

name: databricks_get_app_deployment
description: Get details of a specific app deployment.

arguments.name: app_name
arguments.desc: The name of the app.

arguments.name: deployment_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the deployment to retrieve.

name: databricks_get_app_environment
description: Get the environment configuration for a Databricks App.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the app whose environment to retrieve.

name: databricks_create_execution_context
description: Create an execution context on a running cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of a running cluster.

arguments.name: language
arguments.desc: Programming language for the context. One of

name: databricks_execute_command
description: Execute a command in an existing execution context.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster.

arguments.name: context_id
arguments.desc: The execution context ID returned by

arguments.name: language
arguments.desc: Programming language of the command. One of

arguments.name: command
arguments.desc: The code to execute (e.g. "print('hello')" for

name: databricks_command_status
description: Check the status and results of an executed command.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster.

arguments.name: context_id
arguments.desc: The execution context ID.

arguments.name: command_id
arguments.desc: The command ID returned by databricks_execute_command.

name: databricks_destroy_execution_context
description: Destroy an execution context on a cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster.

arguments.name: context_id
arguments.desc: The execution context ID to destroy.

name: databricks_list_clusters
description: List all compute clusters in the workspace.

name: databricks_get_cluster
description: Get detailed information about a specific compute cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster.

name: databricks_create_cluster
description: Create a new compute cluster.

arguments.desc: Display name for the cluster.

arguments.name: spark_version
arguments.desc: Spark runtime version string

arguments.name: node_type_id
arguments.desc: Instance type for worker nodes

arguments.name: num_workers
arguments.desc: Number of worker nodes for a fixed-size cluster.

arguments.name: autoscale_min
arguments.desc: Minimum number of workers when autoscaling is enabled.

arguments.name: autoscale_max
arguments.desc: Maximum number of workers when autoscaling is enabled.

name: databricks_start_cluster
description: Start a terminated compute cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to start.

name: databricks_terminate_cluster
description: Terminate a running compute cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to terminate.

name: databricks_restart_cluster
description: Restart a running compute cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to restart.

name: databricks_resize_cluster
description: Resize a running cluster to a different number of workers.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to resize.

arguments.name: num_workers
arguments.desc: The new number of worker nodes. Use 0 for a

name: databricks_list_instance_pools
description: List all instance pools in the workspace.

name: databricks_get_instance_pool
description: Get detailed information about a specific instance pool.

arguments.name: instance_pool_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the instance pool.

name: databricks_list_cluster_policies
description: List all cluster policies in the workspace.

name: databricks_edit_cluster
description: Edit the configuration of an existing compute cluster.

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to edit.

arguments.name: cluster_name
arguments.desc: New display name for the cluster.

arguments.name: spark_version
arguments.desc: Spark runtime version string

arguments.name: node_type_id
arguments.desc: Instance type for worker nodes

arguments.name: num_workers
arguments.desc: Number of worker nodes. Use 0 for a single-node

name: databricks_pin_cluster
description: Pin a compute cluster to prevent it from being auto-deleted.

arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to pin.

name: databricks_unpin_cluster
description: Unpin a compute cluster, allowing it to be auto-deleted.

arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster to unpin.

name: databricks_list_cluster_events
description: List recent events for a compute cluster.

arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the cluster.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Maximum number of events to return. Defaults to 50.

name: databricks_list_node_types
description: List all available node types for compute clusters.

name: databricks_list_spark_versions
description: List all available Spark runtime versions.

name: databricks_create_instance_pool
description: Create a new instance pool.

arguments.name: instance_pool_name
arguments.desc: Display name for the instance pool.

arguments.name: node_type_id

arguments.name: min_idle_instances

arguments.name: max_capacity
arguments.desc: Maximum total instances the pool can hold (idle +

arguments.name: idle_instance_autotermination_minutes

description: Delete an instance pool.

description: Create a new external connection.

arguments.name: options_json

arguments.name: comment
arguments.desc: Optional human-readable description of the connection.

description: Update an existing connection's options or name.

arguments.desc: Optional JSON string of key-value options to set.

arguments.name: new_name
arguments.desc: Optional new name for the connection. Leave empty to

name: databricks_delete_connection
description: Delete an external connection.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: Name of the connection to delete.

name: databricks_list_jobs
description: List jobs in the workspace.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Maximum number of jobs to return. Must be between 1 and 100.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: Optional filter to return only jobs whose name contains this

name: databricks_get_job
description: Get detailed information about a specific job.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the job.

name: databricks_create_job
description: Create a new job with a single task.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: Human-readable name for the job. Does not need to be unique.

arguments.name: task_key
arguments.desc: Unique key for the task within this job. Used to identify

arguments.name: notebook_path
arguments.desc: Workspace path to the notebook to run (e.g.

arguments.name: python_file
arguments.desc: Path to a Python file in DBFS, workspace, or cloud storage

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: ID of an existing all-purpose cluster to run the task on.

name: databricks_delete_job
description: Delete a job and all its associated runs.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the job to delete.

name: databricks_run_job
description: Trigger a new run of an existing job.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the job to run.

name: databricks_list_runs
description: List job runs, optionally filtered by job ID.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: Filter runs to this specific job. If 0 or omitted, returns

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Maximum number of runs to return. Must be between 1 and 100.

name: databricks_get_run
description: Get detailed information about a specific job run.

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the run.

name: databricks_cancel_run
description: Cancel an active job run.

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the run to cancel.

name: databricks_get_run_output
description: Get the output of a completed job run.

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the run.

name: databricks_export_run
description: Export the content of a job run.

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the run to export.

name: databricks_update_job
description: Update the settings of an existing job.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the job to update.

arguments.name: new_settings
arguments.desc: JSON string containing the new job settings.

name: databricks_cancel_all_runs
description: Cancel all active runs of a job.

arguments.name: job_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the job whose runs

name: databricks_repair_run
description: Repair a failed job run by re-running specific tasks.

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The unique numeric identifier of the run to repair.

arguments.name: rerun_tasks
arguments.desc: Comma-separated list of task keys to re-run

name: databricks_list_metastores
description: List all Unity Catalog metastores accessible to the caller.

name: databricks_get_metastore
description: Get detailed information about a specific metastore.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier (UUID) of the metastore.

name: databricks_current_metastore
description: Get the metastore assigned to the current workspace.

name: databricks_metastore_summary
description: Get a summary of the metastore assigned to the current workspace.

name: databricks_create_metastore
description: Create a new Unity Catalog metastore.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: Name for the new metastore. Must be unique within the account.

arguments.name: storage_root
arguments.desc: Cloud storage root URL for the metastore's managed data

arguments.name: region
arguments.desc: Optional cloud region for the metastore (e.g. "us-east-1").

name: databricks_update_metastore
description: Update properties of an existing metastore.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier (UUID) of the metastore to update.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: Optional new name for the metastore.

arguments.name: owner
arguments.desc: Optional new owner of the metastore (user or group name).

arguments.name: storage_root_credential_id
arguments.desc: Optional ID of the storage credential

name: databricks_delete_metastore
description: Delete a Unity Catalog metastore.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier (UUID) of the metastore to delete.

arguments.name: force
arguments.desc: If True, forcibly delete the metastore and all its contents.

name: databricks_assign_metastore
description: Assign a metastore to a workspace.

arguments.name: workspace_id
arguments.desc: The numeric ID of the Databricks workspace.

arguments.name: metastore_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier (UUID) of the metastore to assign.

arguments.name: default_catalog_name
arguments.desc: The name of the default catalog to use in the

arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the pipeline to update.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: New name for the pipeline. Leave empty to keep the current name.

arguments.name: target
arguments.desc: New target schema. Leave empty to keep the current target.

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.desc: New Unity Catalog catalog. Leave empty to keep the current catalog.

description: Delete a DLT pipeline.

arguments.name: full_refresh
arguments.desc: If True, reprocesses all data from scratch, dropping and

name: databricks_stop_pipeline
description: Stop a running pipeline.

arguments.name: pipeline_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the pipeline to stop.

name: databricks_list_pipeline_events
description: List recent events for a DLT pipeline.

arguments.name: pipeline_id
arguments.desc: The unique identifier of the pipeline.

arguments.name: max_results
arguments.desc: Maximum number of events to return. Defaults to 25.

name: databricks_list_secret_scopes
description: List all secret scopes in the workspace.

name: databricks_delete_secret_scope

arguments.name: key

arguments.desc: The principal (user or group) to grant access to.

arguments.name: permission
arguments.desc: Permission level to grant. Must be one of:

name: databricks_list_serving_endpoints

arguments.name: workload_size
arguments.desc: Compute size per replica. One of "Small", "Medium", "Large".

arguments.name: scale_to_zero
arguments.desc: Whether the endpoint scales to zero replicas when idle.

arguments.name: workload_size
arguments.desc: Compute size per replica. One of "Small", "Medium", "Large".

arguments.name: scale_to_zero
arguments.desc: Whether the endpoint scales to zero when idle.

name: databricks_workspace_status
description: Get a comprehensive status overview of the Databricks workspace.

name: databricks_setup_schema
description: Create a catalog (optionally) and schema in one step.

arguments.name: catalog_name
arguments.desc: Name of the parent catalog.

arguments.name: schema_name
arguments.desc: Name of the schema to create.

arguments.name: comment
arguments.desc: Optional description for the schema.

arguments.name: create_catalog
arguments.desc: If True, create the catalog first (skips if it already exists).

name: databricks_query_as_markdown
description: Execute a SQL query and return results formatted as a markdown table.

arguments.name: warehouse_id
arguments.desc: ID of the SQL warehouse to use.

arguments.name: sql
arguments.desc: The SQL statement to execute.

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.desc: Optional catalog context for the query.

arguments.name: schema
arguments.desc: Optional schema context for the query.

name: databricks_find_and_start_warehouse
description: Find an available SQL warehouse and start it if needed.

name: databricks_table_preview
description: Preview a table's schema and sample data in one call.

arguments.name: table_name
arguments.desc: Full three-level table name (catalog.schema.table).

arguments.name: warehouse_id
arguments.desc: SQL warehouse ID to use. If empty, finds one automatically.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Number of sample rows to return. Defaults to 10.

name: databricks_list_workspace
description: List objects in a workspace directory.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path to list (default: root "/").

name: databricks_get_workspace_status
description: Get the status and metadata of a workspace object.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path of the object.

name: databricks_import_notebook
description: Import a notebook or file into the workspace.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path where the notebook will be created.

arguments.name: content
arguments.desc: Base64-encoded content of the notebook.

arguments.name: format
arguments.desc: Import format — "SOURCE" (default), "HTML", "JUPYTER",

arguments.name: language
arguments.desc: Notebook language — "PYTHON" (default), "SQL", "SCALA",

arguments.name: overwrite
arguments.desc: If True, overwrite any existing object at the path.

name: databricks_export_notebook
description: Export a notebook from the workspace.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path of the notebook to export.

name: databricks_mkdirs
description: Create a directory in the workspace.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path of the directory to create.

name: databricks_delete_workspace
description: Delete a workspace object or directory.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Absolute workspace path of the object to delete.

arguments.name: recursive
arguments.desc: If True, recursively delete all contents of a directory.

name: databricks_list_repos
description: List all Git repositories configured in the workspace.

name: databricks_get_repo
description: Get detailed information about a specific Git repository.

arguments.name: repo_id
arguments.desc: The numeric ID of the repository.

description: Add a Git repository to the workspace.

arguments.name: provider
arguments.desc: Git provider — "github" (default), "gitlab",

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Optional workspace path for the repo. If empty, the

name: databricks_update_repo
description: Update a Git repository to a different branch or tag.

arguments.name: repo_id
arguments.desc: The numeric ID of the repository.

arguments.name: branch
arguments.desc: The name of the branch to check out (e.g. "main", "develop").
